column4: why is it that on the terminal says that i have a 800 mhz prcessor when i have a 1.6 g
CPU scaling: linux wont use all of the processor unless it needs it
it should scale it up to 100% when the system needs more cycles
run gnome-system-monitor, on the processes tab, click the %CPU column until there is an ^ arrow, and see what programs are taking up the most processor
